organization.fullName: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

identificationModule.briefTitle: The Prevalence of Local Immunoglobulin E (IgE) Elevation and Its Effect on Intranasal Capsaicin Therapy in the Non-allergic Rhinitis Population
identificationModule.officialTitle: The Prevalence of Local IgE Elevation and Its Effect on Intranasal Capsaicin Therapy in the Non-allergic Rhinitis Population

responsibleParty.investigatorAffiliation: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

leadSponsor.name: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The purpose of this study to determine the therapeutic response of non-allergic rhinitis patients that have been subtyped as non-allergic rhinitis with local IgE elevation or non-allergic rhinopathy to intranasal capsaicin based on visual analog scale and optical rhinometry, to determine the prevalence of non-allergic rhinitis with local IgE elevation in this study's cohort of patients with non-allergic rhinitis identified by rhinitis history and negative skin testing for allergic rhinitis, and to determine the change, if any, in intranasal IgE levels after capsaicin treatment.

interventions.name: Intranasal capsaicin
interventions.description: Intranasal capsaicin, 5 applications each delivering 2 micrograms in each nostril, separated by 1 hour.

interventions.name: topical lidocaine
interventions.description: The nose will be pre-treated with topical lidocaine 15 minutes before each application

primaryOutcomes.measure: Runny Nose as Measured by the Visual Analog Scale (VAS) at Baseline
primaryOutcomes.description: The Visual analog scale is scored from 0-10, with 0 being not a problem and 10 being unbearable.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Runny Nose as Measured by the Visual Analog Scale (VAS) at 4 Weeks Post Treatment
primaryOutcomes.description: The Visual analog scale is scored from 0-10, with 0 being not a problem and 10 being unbearable.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Runny Nose as Measured by the Visual Analog Scale (VAS) at 12 Weeks Post Treatment
primaryOutcomes.description: The Visual analog scale is scored from 0-10, with 0 being not a problem and 10 being unbearable.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Nasal Symptoms of Congestion as Measured by the Visual Analog Scale (VAS) at Baseline
primaryOutcomes.description: The Visual analog scale is scored from 0-10, with 0 being not a problem and 10 being unbearable.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Nasal Symptoms of Congestion as Measured by the Visual Analog Scale (VAS) at 4 Weeks Post Treatment
primaryOutcomes.description: The Visual analog scale is scored from 0-10, with 0 being not a problem and 10 being unbearable.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Nasal Symptoms of Congestion as Measured by the Visual Analog Scale (VAS) at 12 Weeks Post Treatment
primaryOutcomes.description: The Visual analog scale is scored from 0-10, with 0 being not a problem and 10 being unbearable.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Nasal Itching as Measured by the Visual Analog Scale (VAS at Baseline
primaryOutcomes.description: The Visual analog scale is scored from 0-10, with 0 being not a problem and 10 being unbearable.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Nasal Itching as Measured by the Visual Analog Scale (VAS) at 4 Weeks Post Treatment
primaryOutcomes.description: The Visual analog scale is scored from 0-10, with 0 being not a problem and 10 being unbearable.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Nasal Itching as Measured by the Visual Analog Scale (VAS) at 12 Weeks Post Treatment
primaryOutcomes.description: The Visual analog scale is scored from 0-10, with 0 being not a problem and 10 being unbearable.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Nasal Sneezing as Measured by the Visual Analog Scale (VAS) at Baseline
primaryOutcomes.description: The Visual analog scale is scored from 0-10, with 0 being not a problem and 10 being unbearable.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Nasal Sneezing as Measured by the Visual Analog Scale (VAS) at 4 Weeks Post Treatment
primaryOutcomes.description: The Visual analog scale is scored from 0-10, with 0 being not a problem and 10 being unbearable.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Nasal Sneezing as Measured by the Visual Analog Scale (VAS) at 12 Weeks Post Treatment
primaryOutcomes.description: The Visual analog scale is scored from 0-10, with 0 being not a problem and 10 being unbearable.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Change in Maximum Optical Density Determined Via Optical Rhinometry
primaryOutcomes.description: Optical rhinometry provides continuous measurement of blood flow in nasal vessels (via optical density measurements), which serves as an indirect assessment of nasal congestion. A greater decrease in optical density (OD) from baseline indicates less nasal blood flow and decreased congestion relative to baseline.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: baseline, immediately post first treatment on Day 1

primaryOutcomes.measure: Total Nasal Symptom Score as Measured by the Visual Analog Scale (VAS) at Baseline
primaryOutcomes.description: Total Nasal Symptom score is measured as the sum of four symptom scores for runny nose, nasal symptoms of congestion, nasal itching and sneezing. Each symptom is scored from 0-10, with 0 being not a problem and 10 being unbearable. The Total nasal symptom score ranges from 0 - 40, the lower the score the better the outcome.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Total Nasal Symptom Score as Measured by the Visual Analog Scale (VAS) at 4 Weeks Post Treatment
primaryOutcomes.description: Total Nasal Symptom score is measured as the sum of four symptom scores for runny nose, nasal symptoms of congestion, nasal itching and sneezing. Each symptom is scored from 0-10, with 0 being not a problem and 10 being unbearable. The Total nasal symptom score ranges from 0 - 40, the lower the score the better the outcome.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Total Nasal Symptom Score as Measured by the Visual Analog Scale (VAS) at 12 Weeks Post Treatment
primaryOutcomes.description: Total Nasal Symptom score is measured as the sum of four symptom scores for runny nose, nasal symptoms of congestion, nasal itching and sneezing. Each symptom is scored from 0-10, with 0 being not a problem and 10 being unbearable. The Total nasal symptom score ranges from 0 - 40, the lower the score the better the outcome.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Maximum Optical Density Determined Via Optical Rhinometry

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in Local Immunoglobulin E (IgE) Level
secondaryOutcomes.description: The IgE levels will be obtained from the brush biopsy of the inferior turbinates. Change from baseline in local Immunoglobulin E (IgE) level after 12 weeks post treatment. Data reported is the 12 weeks post treatment value minus the baseline value.

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Chronic rhinitis

Exclusion Criteria:

* Active smoker
* Anatomic source of nasal symptoms
* Chronic rhinosinusitis or other nasal infection
* History of sinonasal malignancy
* Pregnancy or lactation
* Use of medication affecting nasal function (topical steroids, topical anticholinergics, oral antihistamines) in the previous 4 weeks
* Use or abuse of nasal decongestants.
* Positive skin prick test for allergic rhinitis

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Maximum Optical Density Determined Via Optical Rhinometry
outcomeMeasures.description: Optical rhinometry provides continuous measurement of blood flow in nasal vessels (via optical density measurements), which serves as an indirect assessment of nasal congestion. A greater decrease in optical density (OD) from baseline indicates less nasal blood flow and decreased congestion relative to baseline.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Data were not collected for 6 participants in the treatment arm.
outcomeMeasures.unitOfMeasure: log ratio of light in to light out (OD)
outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: baseline, immediately post first treatment on Day 1
